intro: Craspedorhachis, commonly known as the horned grass, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy or bristly leaves and specialized inflorescences. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist or wetland environments. Its name derives from the Greek words for "horn" and "grass," reflecting its unique morphological features. Craspedorhachis species are generally herbaceous and play a role in local ecosystems as a food source for various insects and animals.
